title: Introduction
code: mtcars |>   ggplot(aes(x = factor(cyl),              fill = factor(am))) +   theme_RR() +   geom_bar_RR() +   labs(title = "Dette er et søylediagram",        subtitle = "Fordelt på undergrupper",        x = "Gruppe",        y = "Antall",        fill = "Kategori") +   scale_fill_RR() #> Warning: The `size` argument of `element_line()` is deprecated as of ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use the `linewidth` argument instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the rrplot2 package. #>   Please report the issue to the authors. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated.

title: Introduction
code: iris |>   ggplot(aes(x = Sepal.Length,              y = Sepal.Width,              color = Species)) +   theme_RR() +   geom_point_RR() +   labs(title = "Scatterplot",        subtitle = "Dette er en beskrivelse som gir leseren mer informasjon.",        x = "X-variabel",        y = "Y-variabel") +   scale_color_RR()

title: Introduction
code: iris |>    ggplot(aes(x = Sepal.Length,              y = Sepal.Width)) +   geom_point(aes(color = Species)) +   facet_wrap(~ Species,              nrow = 2) +   theme_RR() +   scale_color_RR() +   labs(x = "X-variabel",        y = "Y-variabel",        color = "Gruppe",        title = "Oppdelt plot",        subtitle = "Med flere underkategorier")  +   theme(panel.background = ggplot2::element_rect(fill = "#f9f9f9", linetype = 0))

title: Introduction
code: mtcars |>   ggplot(aes(x = hp,              y = mpg,              color = cyl)) +   theme_RR() +   geom_point_RR() +   labs(x = "X-variabel",        y = "Y-variabel",        color = "Farge") +   scale_color_continuous_RR_red()

title: Introduction
code: mtcars |>   ggplot(aes(x = hp,              y = mpg,              color = cyl)) +   theme_RR() +   geom_point_RR() +   labs(x = "X-variabel",        y = "Y-variabel",        color = "Farge") +   scale_color_continuous_RR_blue()

title: Introduction
code: # Generate example data set.seed(123) data <- data.frame(   Group = rep(c("Group1", "Group2"), each = 200),   Value = c(rnorm(200, mean = 0, sd = 1), rnorm(200, mean = 2, sd = 1)))  # Create density plot data |>   ggplot(aes(x = Value, fill = Group)) +   theme_RR() +   geom_density_RR(alpha = 0.5) +   labs(x = "Value", y = "Density",        fill = "Group",        title = "Density plot",        subtitle = "Med to undergrupper") +   scale_fill_RR()

title: Introduction
code: data("economics_long") economics_long |>    ggplot(aes(x = date, y = value, color = variable)) +   geom_line_RR(linewidth = 0.8) +   labs(title = "Linjediagram med utvikling over tid",        subtitle = "For en rekke økonomiske indikatorer",        x = "År",        y = "Verdi",        color = "Indikator") +   theme_RR() +   scale_color_RR()

title: Introduction
code: economics_long |>    ggplot(aes(x = date, y = value, color = variable)) +   geom_line_RR(linewidth = 0.8) +   labs(title = "Linjediagram med utvikling over tid",        subtitle = "For en rekke økonomiske indikatorer",        x = "År",        y = "Verdi",        color = "Indikator") +   theme_RR() +   scale_color_RR() +   facet_wrap(~variable, scales = "free",              nrow = 3) +   scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0, NA))  +   theme(panel.background = ggplot2::element_rect(fill = "#f9f9f9", linetype = 0)) #> Scale for y is already present. #> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale.

title: Introduction
code: # Dummy data x <- LETTERS[1:20] y <- paste0("var", seq(1,20)) data <- expand.grid(X=x, Y=y) data$Z <- runif(400, 0, 5)   # Heatmap  data |>    ggplot(aes(X,               Y,               fill= Z)) +    geom_tile() +    theme_RR() +   scale_fill_continuous_RR_blue()

title: Introduction
code: data |>    ggplot(aes(X,               Y,               fill= Z)) +    geom_tile() +    theme_RR() +   scale_fill_continuous_RR_red()

title: Introduction
code: data <- data.frame(   Question = rep(c("Spørsmål 1", "Spørsmål 2", "Spørsmål 3"), each = 5),   Response = rep(c("Svært uenig", "Uenig", "Hverken eller", "Enig", "Svært enig"), times = 3),   Count = c(5, 10, 20, 30, 35, 3, 8, 15, 25, 49, 2, 7, 18, 28, 45) )  data$Response <- factor(data$Response,                         levels = c("Svært uenig", "Uenig", "Hverken eller", "Enig", "Svært enig"))   data |>   ggplot(aes(x = Question, y = Count, fill = Response)) +   geom_bar_RR(stat = "identity") +   coord_flip() +   labs(title = "Svar på spørsmål",        subtitle = "Basert på en spørreundersøkelse som går til 100 tilfeldige personer.",        fill = "Kategori",        x = "Spørsmål", y = "Prosent") +   theme_RR() +   scale_fill_traffic_blue_RR()

title: Introduction
code: data |>   ggplot(aes(x = Question, y = Count, fill = Response)) +   geom_bar_RR(stat = "identity") +   coord_flip() +   labs(title = "Svar på spørsmål",        subtitle = "Basert på en spørreundersøkelse som går til 100 tilfeldige personer.",        fill = "Kategori",        x = "Spørsmål", y = "Prosent") +   theme_RR() +   scale_fill_traffic_green_RR()

code: @Manual{,   title = {rrplot2: Custom 'ggplot2' Theme For the Office of the Auditor General of Norway},   author = {Joachim Sandnes},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0.9000},   url = {https://riksrevisjonen.github.io/rrplot2/}, }

what: Custom ggplot2 Theme For the Office of the Auditor General of Norway
title: Custom ggplot2 Theme For the Office of the Auditor General of Norway
text: purpose rrplot provide auditors OAG Norway ability quickly make beautiful graphs ggplot2 accordance official requirements.

title: Custom ggplot2 Theme For the Office of the Auditor General of Norway
text: can install development version rrplot local repository :
code: install.packages("rrplot2", repos = "https://cran.riksrevisjonen.no/latest")

title: Custom ggplot2 Theme For the Office of the Auditor General of Norway
text: adjustments graph aesthetics can found theme_RR() function. simply added layer ggplot call.

title: Custom ggplot2 Theme For the Office of the Auditor General of Norway
text: package also contains custom wrappers following geom functions ggplot2: geom_bar() -> geom_bar_RR() geom_point() -> geom_point_RR() geom_jitter() -> geom_jitter_RR() geom_density() -> geom_density_RR() geom_line() -> geom_line_RR() wrappers also added layers ggplot call, along theme_RR(). Note theme_RR() needs placed geom wrapper (see example ). Using custom wrappers optional, recommended.

title: Custom ggplot2 Theme For the Office of the Auditor General of Norway
text: package contains functions determine color palette graphs. Discrete color palette functions: scale_color_RR(): Used color argument aes() assigned. scale_fill_RR(): Used fill argument aes() assigned. added separate layers ggplot call contain 9 colors:  Continuous color palette functions: scale_fill_continuous_RR_red: Red continuous fill scale #fcb7b9 #a40000 scale_fill_continuous_RR_blue Blue continuous fill scale #b4c6e9 #001b61 scale_color_continuous_RR_red Red continuous color scale #fcb7b9 #a40000 scale_color_continuous_RR_blue Blue continuous color scale #b4c6e9 #001b61
code: library(scales) show_col(RR_pal()(9))

title: Custom ggplot2 Theme For the Office of the Auditor General of Norway
text: basic example shows create bar chart:  Note geom_bar_RR() accepts arguments geom_bar(). , please note theme_RR() needs placed geom_bar() layer. Another example, scatter plot:
code: library(ggplot2) library(rrplot2) #> Attaching system fonts #>  #> Attaching package: 'rrplot2' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:rrplot': #>  #>     check_pal_n_RR, geom_bar_flipped_RR, geom_bar_RR, geom_density_RR, #>     geom_jitter_RR, geom_line_RR, geom_point_RR, RR_pal, #>     scale_color_continuous_RR_blue, scale_color_continuous_RR_red, #>     scale_color_RR, scale_fill_continuous_RR_blue, #>     scale_fill_continuous_RR_red, scale_fill_RR, theme_RR  mtcars |>   ggplot(aes(x = factor(cyl),              fill = factor(am))) +   theme_RR() +   geom_bar_RR() +   labs(title = "Dette er et søylediagram",        subtitle = "Fordelt på undergrupper",        x = "Gruppe",        y = "Antall",        fill = "Kategori") +   scale_fill_RR() iris |>   ggplot(aes(x = Sepal.Length,              y = Sepal.Width,              color = Species)) +   theme_RR() +   geom_point_RR() +   labs(title = "Scatterplot",        subtitle = "Dette er en lenger beskrivelse over flere linjer\nsom gir leseren mer informasjon.",        x = "X-variabel",        y = "Y-variabel") +   scale_color_RR()

title: Custom wrapper for geom_bar — geom_bar_RR
text: Custom wrapper geom_bar

title: Custom wrapper for geom_bar — geom_bar_RR
code: geom_bar_RR(..., width = 0.6)

title: Custom wrapper for geom_bar — geom_bar_RR
text: ... arguments passed layer()'s params argument. arguments broadly fall one 4 categories . Notably, arguments position argument, aesthetics required can passed .... Unknown arguments part 4 categories ignored. Static aesthetics mapped scale, fixed value apply layer whole. example, colour = "red" linewidth = 3. geom's documentation Aesthetics section lists available options. 'required' aesthetics passed params. Please note passing unmapped aesthetics vectors technically possible, order required length guaranteed parallel input data. constructing layer using stat_*() function, ... argument can used pass parameters geom part layer. example stat_density(geom = "area", outline.type = ""). geom's documentation lists parameters can accept. Inversely, constructing layer using geom_*() function, ... argument can used pass parameters stat part layer. example geom_area(stat = "density", adjust = 0.5). stat's documentation lists parameters can accept. key_glyph argument layer() may also passed .... can one functions described key glyphs, change display layer legend. width Bar width. default, set 90% resolution() data.

title: Custom wrapper for geom_bar — geom_bar_RR
code: library(ggplot2) mtcars |> ggplot(aes(x = factor(cyl), fill = factor(am))) + theme_RR() + geom_bar_RR() + labs(title = "Number of Cars per Number of Cylinders", x = "Number of Cylinders", y = "Count") + scale_fill_RR() #> Warning: The `size` argument of `element_line()` is deprecated as of ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use the `linewidth` argument instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the rrplot2 package. #>   Please report the issue to the authors.

title: Custom wrapper for geom_density — geom_density_RR
code: library(ggplot2) # Generate example data set.seed(123) data <- data.frame(   Group = rep(c("Group1", "Group2"), each = 200),   Value = c(rnorm(200, mean = 0, sd = 1), rnorm(200, mean = 2, sd = 1)))  # Create density plot data |>   ggplot(aes(x = Value, fill = Group)) +   theme_RR() +   geom_density_RR(alpha = 0.5) +   labs(x = "Value", y = "Density",        fill = "Group") +   scale_fill_RR()

what: import ggplot2 import scales import ggthemes import sysfonts import showtext — imports
title: import ggplot2 import scales import ggthemes import sysfonts import showtext — imports
text: import ggplot2 import scales import ggthemes import sysfonts import showtext

title: Color scale function — scale_color_RR
text: Color scale function Fill scale function Color scale function (alternative) Fill scale function Color scale function (traffic - blue) Fill scale function Color scale function (traffic - green) Fill scale function Continuous fill scale (red) Continuous fill scale (blue) Continuous color scale (red) Continuous color scale (blue)

title: Color scale function — scale_color_RR
code: scale_color_RR(...)  scale_fill_RR(...)  scale_color_RR_alternative(...)  scale_fill_RR_alternative(...)  scale_color_traffic_blue_RR(...)  scale_fill_traffic_blue_RR(...)  scale_color_traffic_green_RR(...)  scale_fill_traffic_green_RR(...)  scale_fill_continuous_RR_red(...)  scale_fill_continuous_RR_blue(...)  scale_color_continuous_RR_red(...)  scale_color_continuous_RR_blue(...)

title: Color scale function — scale_color_RR
text: ... Arguments passed continuous_scale scale_name name scale used error messages associated scale. palette palette function called numeric vector values 0 1 returns corresponding output values (e.g., scales::pal_area()). breaks One : NULL breaks waiver() default breaks computed transformation object numeric vector positions function takes limits input returns breaks output (e.g., function returned scales::extended_breaks()). Note position scales, limits provided scale expansion. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. minor_breaks One : NULL minor breaks waiver() default breaks (one minor break major break) numeric vector positions function given limits returns vector minor breaks. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. function two arguments, given limits major breaks. n.breaks integer guiding number major breaks. algorithm may choose slightly different number ensure nice break labels. effect breaks = waiver(). Use NULL use default number breaks given transformation. labels One : NULL labels waiver() default labels computed transformation object character vector giving labels (must length breaks) expression vector (must length breaks). See ?plotmath details. function takes breaks input returns labels output. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. limits One : NULL use default scale range numeric vector length two providing limits scale. Use NA refer existing minimum maximum function accepts existing (automatic) limits returns new limits. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. Note setting limits positional scales remove data outside limits. purpose zoom, use limit argument coordinate system (see coord_cartesian()). rescaler function used scale input values range [0, 1]. always scales::rescale(), except diverging n colour gradients (.e., scale_colour_gradient2(), scale_colour_gradientn()). rescaler ignored position scales, always use scales::rescale(). Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. oob One : Function handles limits outside scale limits (bounds). Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. default (scales::censor()) replaces bounds values NA. scales::squish() squishing bounds values range. scales::squish_infinite() squishing infinite values range. trans Deprecated favour transform. call call used construct scale reporting messages. super super class use constructed scale

title: Color scale function — scale_color_RR
code: library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width, color = Species)) + theme_RR() + geom_point_RR() + labs(title = "Scatterplot of Sepal Dimensions", x = "Sepal Length", y = "Sepal Width")  p + scale_color_RR()   # Generate example data library(ggplot2) set.seed(123) data <- data.frame( Group = rep(c("Group1", "Group2"), each = 200), Value = c(rnorm(200, mean = 0, sd = 1), rnorm(200, mean = 2, sd = 1)))  p <- data |> ggplot(aes(x = Value, fill = Group)) + theme_RR() + geom_density_RR(alpha = 0.5) + labs(x = "Value", y = "Density", fill = "Group")  p + scale_fill_RR()   library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width, color = Species)) + theme_RR() + geom_point_RR() + labs(title = "Scatterplot of Sepal Dimensions", x = "Sepal Length", y = "Sepal Width")  p + scale_color_RR_alternative()    # Generate example data library(ggplot2) set.seed(123) data <- data.frame( Group = rep(c("Group1", "Group2"), each = 200), Value = c(rnorm(200, mean = 0, sd = 1), rnorm(200, mean = 2, sd = 1)))  p <- data |> ggplot(aes(x = Value, fill = Group)) + theme_RR() + geom_density_RR(alpha = 0.5) + labs(x = "Value", y = "Density", fill = "Group")  p + scale_fill_RR_alternative()   library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width, color = Species)) + theme_RR() + geom_point_RR() + labs(title = "Scatterplot of Sepal Dimensions", x = "Sepal Length", y = "Sepal Width")  p + scale_color_traffic_blue_RR()   # Generate example data library(ggplot2) set.seed(123) data <- data.frame( Group = rep(c("Group1", "Group2"), each = 200), Value = c(rnorm(200, mean = 0, sd = 1), rnorm(200, mean = 2, sd = 1)))  p <- data |> ggplot(aes(x = Value, fill = Group)) + theme_RR() + geom_density_RR(alpha = 0.5) + labs(x = "Value", y = "Density", fill = "Group")  p + scale_fill_traffic_blue_RR()   library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width, color = Species)) + theme_RR() + geom_point_RR() + labs(title = "Scatterplot of Sepal Dimensions", x = "Sepal Length", y = "Sepal Width")  p + scale_color_traffic_green_RR()   # Generate example data library(ggplot2) set.seed(123) data <- data.frame( Group = rep(c("Group1", "Group2"), each = 200), Value = c(rnorm(200, mean = 0, sd = 1), rnorm(200, mean = 2, sd = 1)))  p <- data |> ggplot(aes(x = Value, fill = Group)) + theme_RR() + geom_density_RR(alpha = 0.5) + labs(x = "Value", y = "Density", fill = "Group")  p + scale_fill_traffic_green_RR()   library(ggplot2) # Generate example data x <- LETTERS[1:20] y <- paste0("var", seq(1,20)) data <- expand.grid(X=x, Y=y) data$Z <- runif(400, 0, 5)  # Heatmap p <- data |> ggplot(aes(X, Y, fill= Z)) + geom_tile() + theme_RR()  p + scale_fill_continuous_RR_red()   library(ggplot2) # Generate example data x <- LETTERS[1:20] y <- paste0("var", seq(1,20)) data <- expand.grid(X=x, Y=y) data$Z <- runif(400, 0, 5)  # Heatmap p <- data |> ggplot(aes(X, Y, fill= Z)) + geom_tile() + theme_RR()  p + scale_fill_continuous_RR_blue()   library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = hp, y = mpg, color = cyl)) + theme_RR() + geom_point_RR()  p + scale_color_continuous_RR_red()  library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = hp, y = mpg, color = cyl)) + theme_RR() + geom_point_RR()  p + scale_color_continuous_RR_blue()

title: Basic theme function to implement the official graph style of the Norwegian Office of the Auditor General. — theme_RR
code: theme_RR(base_size = 12, base_family = "sans", use_avenir = TRUE)

title: Basic theme function to implement the official graph style of the Norwegian Office of the Auditor General. — theme_RR
text: base_size base font size, given pts. base_family base font family use_avenir Bool. TRUE use Avenir font face. Defaults TRUE

title: Basic theme function to implement the official graph style of the Norwegian Office of the Auditor General. — theme_RR
code: library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(mtcars) + geom_point(aes(x = wt, y = mpg, colour = factor(gear)))  p + theme_RR()
